intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ah, we're finally here. Can't say I'm completely used to sea travel yet.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Welcome, Lord/Lady Corrin! We have been waiting for you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You have?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Certainly. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Kotaro, the daimyo of Mokushu.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Mokushu?! That's the place Shura mentioned... The country that...

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Milord/Milady? Is something amiss?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Pardon me, I was just reflecting on our journey here. It was quite eventful. Mokushu lies within Hoshido's territory does it not? Are your certain your people are prepared to ally with Nohr?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Without a doubt, milord/milady. Our people have long been on good terms with Nohr. We always knew we would side with your kingdom when war inevitably broke out.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see. Thank you for your loyalty.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Sorry to rush you after such long journey, but I'd like to show you something. It's the path you'll be using to sneak into Hoshido. This way, milord/milady.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Here we are, milord/milady. This is the quickest and safest route you can take.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Kotaro. We appreciate all the help we can get.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: No problem at all. I would normally invite you back to my castle to rest... But I'm sure you must be in a hurry. Do let me know if there's anything else I can do.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The sentiment is appreciated, but you've already done your fair share.

intro.speaker: Mokushujin
intro.line: Lord Kotaro! I have an urgent r-report!!

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Calm yourself, man! You're in the presence of Lord/Lady Corrin. Show some respect.

intro.speaker: Mokushujin
intro.line: M-my apologies, sir. But please, I must have your attention! Hoshidan ninja have marched into Mokushu, milord! Our forces are fighting them even now in the forest cave. It's not going well...

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Hoshidan ninja?! Dammit, why now?

intro.speaker: Mokushujin
intro.line: They're incredibly skilled, milord. I'm afraid our troops can't hold out much longer... Please, you must send reinforcements right away!

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Bah! Very well. I'll figure something out. You are dismissed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Why are the Hoshidans attacking your people, Kotaro?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: It has been this way ever since the war escalated. Since then, Hoshidan forces have tries to enter our land with increasing frequency. Though we defend our territory, we have never instigated an attack on Hoshido. These attacks are unprovoked, but there's little we can do to stop them.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I thought Hoshido valued peace... Are they punishing you for your loyalty to Nohr?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: I'm afraid so, milord/milady. We've been fighting them off for weeks now. I fact...our reserves are nearly depleted at this point. Lord/Lady Corrin...it pains me dearly to ask a favor of you at a time like this. But for my people, I must. If there's any way you could lend us a hand...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So be it. After all, your people are suffering because of their allegiance to Nohr. As such, the Nohrian army shall aid your cause. Let's go, before it's too late.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Thank you, milord/milady! The people of Mokushu are forever in your debt!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Corrin, I have dispatched all of the Hoshidan soldiers in this area.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I have cleared my area as well.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: We're all done too! Camilla and Leo really showed them what's what, heehee!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Good work everyone. We've basically been doing all the fighting so far... Is Mokushu really this short on soldiers? Perhaps we should ask Father to send them some guards...

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, look out!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh?!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: What kind of a coward would take aim at Lord/Lady Corrin when he/she isn't looking? What?! It can't be...

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Kaze? I didn't expect to see you here.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Hello, Brother.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: The fates are cruel, are they not? But I do not wish to battle my twin again.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Agreed. It pains me to stand opposite you in battle, Brother.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: ...Move along, Kaze. For both of our sakes. My business is with the daimyo, not you.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: I will not stand down. As a soldier of Nohr, I am obligated to protect our allies.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: You don't know what you're saying Kaze! Siding with Nohr is bad enough... But to protect that devil, Kotaro?! I won't allow it!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Why? Has he wronged you somehow?

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Fool! That man...that monster...he killed our father! Even now he has taken Kagero as a hostage to try and make us surrender. Do you really intend to align yourself with such a dishonorable and despicable man?!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: He did what?! Kagero...

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Well, well, well. So the enemy leader has decided to grace us with his presence. Nicely done, Lord/Lady Corrin. You are as skilled as the rumors imply.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kotaro... We need to talk.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Oh no, please don't let me interrupt. Kill him so we can end this battle.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Silence, Kotaro. I need to ask you something. Did you take a ninja named Kagero hostage to try and force Hoshido to surrender?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: What?! Of course not, milord/milady! That man is telling stories.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: My word is my honor, you coward! I swear, I will kill you myself before the day is done!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Calm yourself, Brother.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: If what you say is true, then you won't mind showing me all of your jail cells. Now.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: My jail cells? Do you not trust me, milord/milady?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: If you have done nothing wrong, my request shouldn't be a problem. As an ally of Nohr, I demand you prove the integrity of your word.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin! ... Hmph. You know, for a mutt, you sure are full of yourself.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kotaro!

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Fine, you win. I took a hostage and used her as a bargaining chip. What of it?! A true Nohrian prince/princess would praise me for being so cunning, not threaten me. This is war! Lying and using people is par for the course!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You're wrong, Kotaro. That is not how we do things any longer.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Is that so? Tell it to King Garon, you filthy mutt. When Nohr prevails, he has promised me a huge piece of land to expand my kingdom. No one will get in the way of Mokushu's future glory—not even a Nohrian prince/princess!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: ...I see. So your tactics are a product of my father's influence. Pity. Still, I won't allow this to go any further. I refuse to accept your methods. I shall correct your behavior now and forever, by force if necessary.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: P-Prince Xander?! No! I won't let this happen...

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Mokushujin soldiers?!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We came to your aid because you said you were low on troops. So that was a lie too?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: I won't waste any more breath on you. In death, you shall keep my secrets! We'll tell King Garon his darling children died fighting the Hoshidans, heh heh. If you had just kept your mouths shut, you could have lived. Such a shame. Instead you will all be sacrifices on the altar of my grand ambition!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Everyone! Prepare for battle!

battle.speaker: Saizo
battle.line: I must...not...fall here... My liege still needs me... For him...I shall retreat.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: The new kingdom of Mokushu will be built on your graves! Not even King Garon can stop me now, bwaaahahaha!!

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: No! My ambition... Mokushu's...future...

boss.speaker: Shura
boss.line: Heh... So you're the daimyo of Mokushu, eh? We finally meet.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Who are you? I don't know any generic pirates.

boss.speaker: Shura
boss.line: I am Shura, of Kohga. And you will pay for destroying my people!

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Aw, so you came here to get revenge? That's precious. I've killed dozens of men like you. Lowly drifters without a home. Don't even bother. Like your pathetic kingdom, you don't stand a chance.

boss.speaker: Shura
boss.line: Killing you will be no bother at all. In fact, I'm looking forward to it. And one day I will rebuild Kohga and undo the damage you caused!

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: HA! That's rich. I killed all your people. Burned your village to the ground. All of your ninja combined weren't enough to stop me. Yet you think you alone can kill me?! HAHAHAHA!

boss.speaker: Shura
boss.line: We'll see how funny it is when you're begging for mercy. You took everything from me. Before I rebuild, allow me to return the favor.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Ah, a lovely dream. Let that dream comfort you in your last moments. The last remnant of Kohga ends here!

boss.speaker: Shura
boss.line: For my friends and family...for my honor and vengeance...FOR KOHGA!

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: Kotaro of Mokushu...you will now answer to me for your crimes.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: I answer to no one. Who are you to suggest otherwise?

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: I am Saizo the Fifth, servant to the Hoshidan royal family.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Saizo...that name sounds familiar. I believe I've murdered others of your pitiful lineage.

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: You—! How dare you! My father was an honorable man.

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Honorable? Maybe. Weak? Definitely. That balding old fool had the audacity to lecture me! So naturally...I put an end to his life.

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: I knew you were the one responsible for his death. Coward!

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Bwahaha! Isn't this a stroke of luck? To fell both father and son with the same blade... How poetic!

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: Sorry to disappoint, but I'm about to rewrite your poem's ending...

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Ha! If you're anything like your father, you won't land a single blow!

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: How's that for not landing a single blow?

boss.speaker: Kotaro
boss.line: Ugh... My dreams... My Kingdom!! *cough* *cough* How could I lose...?! *sputter* ...

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: A fitting end. Father...you have been avenged. May you rest in peace now.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: It's over... After all these years, Father's murder has finally been avenged.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Saizo... I swear, I did not know. I was told Father died in the line of duty while fighting in Mokushu. All this time... What a burden that knowledge must have been.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Yes, Brother. That man killed our father and hid the truth from all. But I knew better. I knew Father was too great a warrior to fall so easily in battle. Still, it took me years of searching to uncover the truth Kotaro buried.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Dishonorable scoundrel. No telling how many lives he took without punishment.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Indeed. But it's all over now...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hey, Kaze! Saizo! I found the dungeon where they were keeping Kagero.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: You found her?!

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Saizo!

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Kagero! Are you hurt? Make haste, friend. We must return to Lord Ryoma right away.

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: I am in your debt, Saizo. To save me, you even cooperated with the traitorous Lord/Lady Corrin. That can't have been easy...

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: I cooperated with no one. It is pure coincidence that we crossed paths. They were battling our soldiers and even aiding Kotaro at first. Still, I must know... Corrin! Why didn't you take the lives of the soldiers you bested? I thought mercy was not a concept familiar to Nohrians.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Then perhaps you don't know us as well as you believe you do. We Nohrians aren't all the same. Just as all ninja aren't as vile as Kotaro.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: ...Perhaps so, Corrin. In any case, Kagero and my men are alive thanks to you. You also helped me to finally avenge my father's death. For that...I thank you. But do not let our temporary truce fool you. When next we meet, it will be as enemies. At that time, I will not hesitate to take your life.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: If that is how it must be, Saizo, then so be it. I won't hold back either.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Hmph.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: *sigh*

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Milord/Milady... We should be on our way.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kaze... I'm so sorry. Siding with me has brought you nothing but heartache.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: One cannot escape heartache, milord/milady. No matter the path we choose to follow.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But if it weren't for me... If I had chosen a different path... You might have been fighting alongside your brother instead of against him.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Perhaps. There's no telling what might have come to pass. But who's to say that path would have been the right one? Life is not black or white. Both Nohr and Hoshido are fighting for what they believe in. I truly believe that both sides know that. Even my brother.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Kaze. I hope you're right.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Ah, that reminds me. This is for you... Saizo knows that it's thanks to you he was able to survive Kotaro's attack. I believe he left this as a token of thanks. ...And as a sign that our battle with him is not yet over.
